subject: Initial discovery call with Chevron Permian team
description: Discussed safety valve requirements for upcoming completions campaign. They are looking at 200+ wells in the Midland Basin this year. Follow up with product specs.

subject: Follow-up call with Devon operations
description: Reviewed packer sizing for their DJ Basin completions. They want us to provide engineering analysis.

subject: Site visit to Pioneer Natural Resources completion site
description: Visited Midland Basin completion site to inspect current safety valve installation. Identified opportunity to upgrade to our latest multi-cycle design.

subject: Meeting with ConocoPhillips procurement
description: Quarterly review meeting. Discussed pricing for 2026 contract renewal and new product line expansion.

subject: Inbound inquiry from Equinor engineering team
description: Equinor reached out about geothermal safety valve applications for their North Sea operations. Very interested in our green energy product line.

subject: SPE workshop attendance
description: Attended SPE Well Integrity workshop in Houston. Made contacts with several operators interested in our digital monitoring solutions.

subject: Sent quotation to ExxonMobil Permian
description: Sent formal quotation for 150 safety valves for their Q2 2026 completion program. Total quote value $2.1M.

subject: Email exchange with Shell about training
description: Sent training program details for their GoM operations team. They want onsite training for 20 engineers.

subject: Internal review: Bakken market strategy
description: Reviewed Bakken market opportunities. Key targets: Continental Resources, Hess, Marathon. Need to increase presence in Williston Basin.

subject: PO received from Chevron GoM
description: Purchase order received for 75 subsea safety valves. PO# CVX-GOM-2026-0421. Delivery date: May 2026.

subject: Call with Halliburton about partnership
description: Discussed potential partnership for their well intervention services. They want to bundle our products with their service packages.

subject: Meeting with ADNOC delegation
description: Hosted ADNOC delegation at Houston office. Presented full product line including new completions and green energy solutions.

subject: Follow-up email to Saudi Aramco
description: Sent product specifications and pricing for their 2026 well intervention program as requested during ADIPEC.

subject: Training session: New completions product line
description: Conducted internal training on the new completions product line for the sales team. Covered features, pricing strategy, and competitive positioning.

subject: Quote follow-up call with ExxonMobil
description: Called to follow up on January quote. They are evaluating vs. competitors. Decision expected by end of February.

subject: Shipment dispatched to Chevron Permian
description: Shipped 50 safety valves to Midland, TX distribution center. Tracking# TRE-2026-SHP-0089. Expected arrival Feb 12.

subject: Call with BP about Eagle Ford operations
description: BP reached out about safety valve solutions for their Eagle Ford completions. They are currently using a competitor and looking to switch.

subject: Meeting with Petrobras international team
description: Virtual meeting with Petrobras pre-salt team. Discussed deepwater safety valve specifications for Santos Basin operations.

subject: Internal note: Q1 pipeline review
description: Pipeline is at $15.2M for Q1 with 65% probability-weighted. Need to push harder on Permian and GoM opportunities. ADNOC deal could be transformative for international expansion.

subject: Email from Fervo Energy about geothermal project
description: Fervo Energy requesting information on our geothermal safety valve design for their Project Red facility in Nevada. High-temperature applications up to 400F.
